artist: Artist: Suzuki Harunobu; Author: Komatsuya Hyakki; Publisher: Nishimuraya Yohachi
description: kneeling man at left wearing black jacket and green and white striped kimono with purple trim; two standing small women on a cloud at right; woman at left wearing green kimono with purple and white obi; woman at right wears purple kimono and red and green striped obi; text in a cloud at top and at right edge in grey area
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper with embossing
portfolio: From Elegant Erotic Mane'emon (Fūryū enshoku Mane'emon 風流艶色真似ゑもん)
provenance: The set came from the Nakao family in Osaka, via Hotei Japanese Prints, around 1995 or shortly thereafter, then to a Dutch private collection, then to Scholten Japanese Art.
text: Ukiyonosuke in his original size encounters the famous beauties, Osen of the Kagaya teahouse who is representing the Ryushin shrine, and Ofuji of the Yanagi-ya who represents the Kinryuzan shrine. They offer him the magic shrinking potion in response to his prayers for greater wisdom.
title: Ukiyonosuke Meets Ofuji and Osen at Ryushinzan Shrine, No. 1 from the book Elegant Erotic Mane'emon (Fūryū enshoku Mane'emon), vol. 1
